intro: Cyminosma chinensis, commonly known as Chinese cyminosma, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30-60 cm, with compound leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. Its roots are often used in traditional Chinese medicine for their purported health benefits. Cyminosma chinensis is also valued as a ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and pleasant scent.
